dialogues.line: Ah, welcome, traveler! You look like you could use some fine armor to protect yourself on these dangerous roads.
Nonsense! This one looks sturdy enough. You don’t need all that extra weight slowing you down.
Oh, but that’s where you’re wrong, Sir Knight! This armor here is light as a feather, yet tougher than dragon scales. Perfect for a hero like you, dear customer!
A true warrior doesn’t hide behind steel, my friend. Let them see the courage on your face, not a metal mask.
And what good is courage if you’re filled with arrows? With this armor, you’d laugh at the fiercest foes and keep all your limbs intact!
Bah! Armor like that only serves to lighten your purse, not protect you. A sharp mind and a quick hand will keep you safer than any plated suit.
But what if the enemy is clever, too? Or faster? You’d want every advantage, right? Just imagine—striding into battle, gleaming like a hero from the old tales!
Enough! Armor or not, a true fighter needs only their courage and wits. No need to weigh yourself down, traveler.
But think of the admiration! The respect! Everyone will see you’re a force to be reckoned with.
Or they’ll see someone who paid too much for shiny metal. It’s your choice, traveler.
